page.title: 17YEATHERIDGE FARM CAMP SITE
page.content: Yeatheridge is an unusual farm because it is a camp site as well. It has room for 50 pitches for either caravans or tent. Facilities for campers include a pool table, skittle alley, table tennis, laundry room , telephone, shop, lounge and T.V.room, washroom, ponies, pond, barbecue and a heated indoor swimming pool. The local community can use the pool by appointment. A clubroom with bar is being built. It is a working farm with 300 acres. The land is used for grazing and arable farming. They keep cows, beef cattle, calves, sheep and lambs.Mr and Mrs Hosewood and their two sons work on the farm. Work starts at 6am with milking . After breakfast they feed and bed the animals and work on the land. They also look after and clean the camp site. Work finishes around 7pm.
